units.title: Pre‑coat 24‑well plates with GFR Matrigel
units.text: 1 Pre‑coat 24‑well plates with GFR Matrigel as described in Reagent setup. The coated plates can be wrapped in Paraﬁlm and kept for ≤2 weeks at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Creates a defined extracellular matrix surface for PSC attachment.

units.title: Add accutase to dissociate PSC colonies
units.text: 5 Add 1 ml of accutase to the wells.
units.rationale: Enables enzymatic dissociation of colonies into single cells.

units.title: Centrifuge cells after dissociation
units.text: 8 Centrifuge the cells at 1,000 r.p.m. for 3 min at 4 °C.
units.rationale: Pellets cells for media exchange and counting.

units.title: Plate PSCs with Y‑27632
units.text: 13 Plate the cells at a density of 100,000–150,000 cells/well in 500 μl of mTeSR1 including 10 μM Y‑27632 on a Matrigel‑coated tissue culture 24‑well plate.
units.rationale: Establishes a uniform monolayer while promoting cell survival.

units.title: Change to mTeSR1 without Y‑27632
units.text: 18 Aspirate old mTeSR1 with 10 μM Y‑27632 to change the medium. Add fresh mTeSR1 without Y‑27632 (Step 16), 500 μl/well for a 24‑well plate.
units.rationale: Removes the ROCK inhibitor once cells have attached.

units.title: Dilute TrypLE before spheroid formation
units.text: 34 Add 500 μl of warm DMEM/F12 to each well to sufficiently dilute the TrypLE.
units.rationale: Stops enzymatic activity and prepares cells for aggregation.

units.title: Plate gut cell suspensions for spheroid formation
units.text: 36 Plate the anterior or posterior gut cell suspensions in 96‑well round‑bottom ultra‑low attachment plates at a density of 10,000 cells with 100 μl day 7 medium per well and incubate at 37 °C overnight to form spheroids. Prepare the same number of anterior and posterior spheroids.
units.rationale: Generates uniform 3‑D spheroids from gut progenitors.

units.title: Fuse anterior and posterior spheroids
units.text: 39 Centrifuge the plate at 1,000 r.p.m. for 1 min to gather spheroids and incubate at 37 °C for 24 h to form fused boundary spheroids (anterior‑posterior gut spheroid; A‑P spheroids).
units.rationale: Promotes physical contact and boundary formation between spheroids.

units.title: Embed fused spheroid in Matrigel drop
units.text:
44 Add 20–30 µl/well of 100 % Matrigel (Phenol Red‑Free) on ice to the fused A‑P spheroid in a 1.5‑ml tube. Gently re‑suspend the single A‑P spheroid by using a mechanical pipette with a wide‑bore 200‑µl tip and slowly plate it on a 24‑well tissue culture plate (VWR International) to make a Matrigel drop.
45 Incubate the drop in a CO₂ incubator at 37 °C for 5 min.
units.rationale: Encapsulates the fused spheroid to support 3‑D organoid growth.

units.title: Transfer HBPO to Transwell for air‑liquid interface culture
units.text: 50 Transfer the (dissected or undissected) HBPO to a six‑well Transwell. Add one HBPO per Transwell.
units.rationale: Enables long‑term culture with an air‑liquid interface to enhance maturation.
